00014  die('failed to include_once(phpthumb.functions.php) - realpath="'.realpath('phpthumb.functions.php').'"');

00020 // * DocumentRoot configuration
00021 // phpThumb() depends on $_SERVER['DOCUMENT_ROOT'] to resolve path/filenames. This value is almost always correct,
00022 // but has been known to be broken on rare occasion. This value allows you to override the default value.
00023 // Do not modify from the default value of $_SERVER['DOCUMENT_ROOT'] unless you are having problems.
00024 //$PHPTHUMB_CONFIG['document_root'] = '/home/httpd/httpdocs';
00025 //$PHPTHUMB_CONFIG['document_root'] = 'c:\\webroot\\example.com\\www';
00026 //echo @$_SERVER['DOCUMENT_ROOT'].$_SERVER['PHP_SELF'].' = '.phpthumb_functions::md5_file_safe(@$_SERVER['DOCUMENT_ROOT'].$_SERVER['PHP_SELF']).'<br />';
00027 //echo realpath('.').'/'.basename($_SERVER['PHP_SELF']).' = '.phpthumb_functions::md5_file_safe(realpath('.').'/'.basename($_SERVER['PHP_SELF'])).'<br />';
00028 //exit;
00029 $PHPTHUMB_CONFIG['document_root'] = ((@$_SERVER['DOCUMENT_ROOT'] && file_exists(@$_SERVER['DOCUMENT_ROOT'].$_SERVER['PHP_SELF']) && (@phpthumb_functions::md5_file_safe(@$_SERVER['DOCUMENT_ROOT'].$_SERVER['PHP_SELF']) == @phpthumb_functions::md5_file_safe(realpath('.').'/'.basename($_SERVER['PHP_SELF'])))) ? $_SERVER['DOCUMENT_ROOT'] : str_replace(dirname(@$_SERVER['PHP_SELF']), '', str_replace('\\', '/', realpath('.'))));

00032 // * Cache directory configuration (choose only one of these - leave the other lines commented-out):
00033 // Note: this directory must be writable (usually chmod 777 is neccesary) for caching to work.
00034 // If the directory is not writable no error will be generated but caching will be disabled.
00035 $PHPTHUMB_CONFIG['cache_directory'] = dirname(__FILE__).'/cache/';                            // set the cache directory relative to the phpThumb() installation
00036 //$PHPTHUMB_CONFIG['cache_directory'] = $PHPTHUMB_CONFIG['document_root'].'/phpthumb/cache/'; // set the cache directory to an absolute directory for all source images
00037 //$PHPTHUMB_CONFIG['cache_directory'] = './cache/';                                           // set the cache directory relative to the source image - must start with '.' (will not work to cache URL- or database-sourced images, please use an absolute directory name)
00038 //$PHPTHUMB_CONFIG['cache_directory'] = null;                                                 // disable thumbnail caching (not recommended)
00039 
00040 $PHPTHUMB_CONFIG['cache_disable_warning'] = false; // If [cache_directory] is non-existant or not writable, and [cache_disable_warning] is false, an error image will be generated warning to either set the cache directory or disable the warning (to avoid people not knowing about the cache)
00041 
00042 
00043 // * Cache culling: phpThumb can automatically limit the contents of the cache directory
00044 // based on last-access date and/or number of files and/or total filesize.
00045 $PHPTHUMB_CONFIG['cache_maxage'] = null;         // never delete cached thumbnails based on last-access time
00046 //$PHPTHUMB_CONFIG['cache_maxage'] = 86400 * 30; // delete cached thumbnails that haven't been accessed in more than [30 days] (value is maximum time since last access in seconds to avoid deletion)
00047 
00048 //$PHPTHUMB_CONFIG['cache_maxsize'] = null;   // never delete cached thumbnails based on byte size of cache directory
00049 $PHPTHUMB_CONFIG['cache_maxsize'] = 10485760; // delete least-recently-accessed cached thumbnails when more than [10MB] of cached files are present (value is maximum bytesize of all cached files)
00050 
00051 $PHPTHUMB_CONFIG['cache_maxfiles'] = null;  // never delete cached thumbnails based on number of cached files
00052 //$PHPTHUMB_CONFIG['cache_maxfiles'] = 500; // delete least-recently-accessed cached thumbnails when more than [500] cached files are present (value is maximum number of cached files to keep)
00053 
00054 
00055 // * Source image cache configuration
00056 $PHPTHUMB_CONFIG['cache_source_enabled']   = false;                               // if true, source images obtained via HTTP are cached to $PHPTHUMB_CONFIG['cache_source_directory']
00057 $PHPTHUMB_CONFIG['cache_source_directory'] = dirname(__FILE__).'/cache/source/';  // set the cache directory for unprocessed source images
00058 
00059 // * cache source modification date configuration
00060 $PHPTHUMB_CONFIG['cache_source_filemtime_ignore_local']  = false; // if true, local source images will not be checked for modification date and cached image will be used if available, even if source image is changed or removed
00061 $PHPTHUMB_CONFIG['cache_source_filemtime_ignore_remote'] = false; // if true, remote source images will not be checked for modification date and cached image will be used if available, even if source image is changed or removed
00062 
00063 
00064 // * Temp directory configuration
00065 // phpThumb() may need to create temp files. Usually the system temp dir is writable and can be used.
00066 // Leave this value as NULL in most cases. If you get errors about "failed to open <filename> for writing"
00067 // you should change this to a full pathname to a directory you do have write access to.
00068 //$PHPTHUMB_CONFIG['temp_directory'] = '/tmp/';
00069 $PHPTHUMB_CONFIG['temp_directory'] = null;
00070 
00071 
00072 // maximum number of pixels in source image to attempt to process entire image.
00073 // If this is zero then no limit on source image dimensions.
00074 // If this is nonzero then this is the maximum number of pixels the source image
00075 // can have to be processed normally, otherwise the embedded EXIF thumbnail will
00076 // be used (if available) or an "image too large" notice will be displayed.
00077 // This is to be used for large source images (> 1600x1200) and low PHP memory
00078 // limits. If PHP runs out of memory the script will usually just die with no output.
00079 // To calculate this number, multiply the dimensions of the largest image
00080 // you can process with your memory limitation (e.g. 1600 * 1200 = 1920000)
00081 // As a general guideline, this number will be about 20% of your PHP memory
00082 // configuration, so 8M = 1,677,722; 16M = 3,355,443; 32M = 6,710,886; etc.
00083 if (phpthumb_functions::version_compare_replacement(phpversion(), '4.3.2', '>=') && !defined('memory_get_usage') && !@ini_get('memory_limit')) {
00084  // memory_get_usage() will only be defined if your PHP is compiled with the --enable-memory-limit configuration option.
00085  $PHPTHUMB_CONFIG['max_source_pixels'] = 0;         // no memory limit
00086 } else {
00087  // calculate default max_source_pixels as 20% of memory limit configuration
00088  $PHPTHUMB_CONFIG['max_source_pixels'] = round(max(intval(ini_get('memory_limit')), intval(get_cfg_var('memory_limit'))) * 1048576 * 0.20);
00089  //$PHPTHUMB_CONFIG['max_source_pixels'] = 0;       // no memory limit
00090  //$PHPTHUMB_CONFIG['max_source_pixels'] = 1920000; // allow 1600x1200 images (2Mpx), no larger (about 10MB memory required)
00091  //$PHPTHUMB_CONFIG['max_source_pixels'] = 3355443; // 16MB memory limit
00092  //$PHPTHUMB_CONFIG['max_source_pixels'] = 3871488; // allow 2272x1704 images (4Mpx), no larger (about 16MB memory required)
00093 }
00094 
00095 
00096 // ImageMagick configuration
00097 // If source image is larger than available memory limits as defined above in
00098 // 'max_source_pixels' AND ImageMagick's "convert" program is available, phpThumb()
00099 // will call ImageMagick to perform the thumbnailing of the source image to bypass
00100 // the memory limitation. Leaving the value as NULL will cause phpThumb() to
00101 // attempt to detect ImageMagick's presence with `which`
00102 if (strtoupper(substr(PHP_OS, 0, 3)) == 'WIN') {
00103  // Windows: set absolute pathname
00104  $PHPTHUMB_CONFIG['imagemagick_path'] = 'C:\\Program Files\\ImageMagick-6.0.6-Q16\\convert.exe';
00105 } else {
00106  // *nix: set absolute pathname to "convert", or leave as null if "convert" is in the path
00107  //$PHPTHUMB_CONFIG['imagemagick_path'] = '/usr/local/bin/convert';
00108  $PHPTHUMB_CONFIG['imagemagick_path'] = null;
00109 }
00110 
00111 
00112 // * Default output configuration:
00113 $PHPTHUMB_CONFIG['output_format']    = 'jpeg'; // default output format ('jpeg', 'png' or 'gif') - thumbnail will be output in this format (if available in your version of GD). This is always overridden by ?f=___ GETstring parameter
00114 $PHPTHUMB_CONFIG['output_maxwidth']  = 0;      // default maximum thumbnail width.  If this is zero then default width  is the width  of the source image. This is always overridden by ?w=___ GETstring parameter
00115 $PHPTHUMB_CONFIG['output_maxheight'] = 0;      // default maximum thumbnail height. If this is zero then default height is the height of the source image. This is always overridden by ?h=___ GETstring parameter
00116 $PHPTHUMB_CONFIG['output_interlace'] = true;   // if true: interlaced output for GIF/PNG, progressive output for JPEG; if false: non-interlaced for GIF/PNG, baseline for JPEG.
00117 
00118 // * Error message configuration
00119 $PHPTHUMB_CONFIG['error_image_width']           = 48;      // default width for error images
00120 $PHPTHUMB_CONFIG['error_image_height']          = 48;      // default height for error images
00121 $PHPTHUMB_CONFIG['error_message_image_default'] = '';       // Set this to the name of a generic error image (e.g. '/images/error.png') that you want displayed in place of any error message that may occur. This setting is overridden by the 'err' parameter, which does the same thing.
00122 $PHPTHUMB_CONFIG['error_bgcolor']               = 'CCCCFF'; // background color of error message images
00123 $PHPTHUMB_CONFIG['error_textcolor']             = 'FF0000'; // color of text in error messages
00124 $PHPTHUMB_CONFIG['error_fontsize']              = 1;        // size of text in error messages, from 1 (smallest) to 5 (largest)
00125 $PHPTHUMB_CONFIG['error_die_on_error']          = true;     // die with error message on any fatal error (recommended with standalone phpThumb.php)
00126 $PHPTHUMB_CONFIG['error_silent_die_on_error']   = false;    // simply die with no output of any kind on fatal errors (not recommended)
00127 $PHPTHUMB_CONFIG['error_die_on_source_failure'] = false;    // die with error message if source image cannot be processed by phpThumb() (usually because source image is corrupt in some way). If false (default) the source image will be passed through unprocessed, if true an error message will be displayed.
00128 
00129 // * Off-server Thumbnailing Configuration:
00130 $PHPTHUMB_CONFIG['nohotlink_enabled']           = true;                                     // If false will allow thumbnailing from any source domain
00131 $PHPTHUMB_CONFIG['nohotlink_valid_domains']     = array(@$_SERVER['HTTP_HOST']);            // This is the list of domains for which thumbnails are allowed to be created. The default value of the current domain should be fine in most cases, but if neccesary you can add more domains in here, in the format 'www.example.com'
00132 $PHPTHUMB_CONFIG['nohotlink_erase_image']       = true;                                     // if true thumbnail is covered up with $PHPTHUMB_CONFIG['nohotlink_fill_color'] before text is applied, if false text is written over top of thumbnail
00133 $PHPTHUMB_CONFIG['nohotlink_text_message']      = 'Off-server thumbnailing is not allowed'; // text of error message
00134 // * Off-server Linking Configuration:
00135 $PHPTHUMB_CONFIG['nooffsitelink_enabled']       = true;                                       // If false will allow thumbnails to be linked to from any domain, if true only domains listed below in 'nooffsitelink_valid_domains' will be allowed.
00136 $PHPTHUMB_CONFIG['nooffsitelink_valid_domains'] = array(@$_SERVER['HTTP_HOST']);              // This is the list of domains for which thumbnails are allowed to be created. The default value of the current domain should be fine in most cases, but if neccesary you can add more domains in here, in the format 'www.example.com'
00137 $PHPTHUMB_CONFIG['nooffsitelink_require_refer'] = false;                                      // If false will allow standalone calls to phpThumb(). If true then only requests with a $_SERVER['HTTP_REFERER'] value in 'nooffsitelink_valid_domains' are allowed.
00138 $PHPTHUMB_CONFIG['nooffsitelink_erase_image']   = true;                                       // if true thumbnail is covered up with $PHPTHUMB_CONFIG['nohotlink_fill_color'] before text is applied, if false text is written over top of thumbnail
00139 $PHPTHUMB_CONFIG['nooffsitelink_text_message']  = 'Image taken from '.@$_SERVER['HTTP_HOST']; // text of error message
00140 
00141 // * Border & Background default colors
00142 $PHPTHUMB_CONFIG['border_hexcolor']     = '000000'; // Default border color - usual HTML-style hex color notation (overidden with 'bc' parameter)
00143 $PHPTHUMB_CONFIG['background_hexcolor'] = 'FFFFFF'; // Default background color when thumbnail aspect ratio does not match fixed-dimension box - usual HTML-style hex color notation (overridden with 'bg' parameter)
00144 
00145 // * Watermark configuration
00146 $PHPTHUMB_CONFIG['ttf_directory'] = dirname(__FILE__).'/fonts'; // Base directory for TTF font files
00147 //$PHPTHUMB_CONFIG['ttf_directory'] = 'c:/windows/fonts';
00148 
00149 
00150 $PHPTHUMB_CONFIG['high_security_enabled']  = false; // if enabled, requires 'high_security_password' set to at least 5 characters, and requires the use of phpThumbURL() function (at the bottom of phpThumb.config.php) to generate hashed URLs
00151 $PHPTHUMB_CONFIG['high_security_password'] = '';    // required if 'high_security_enabled' is true, must be at least 5 characters long
00152 $PHPTHUMB_CONFIG['disable_debug']          = false; // Prevent phpThumb from displaying any information about your system. If true, phpThumbDebug and error messages will be disabled
00153 
00154 
00155 $PHPTHUMB_CONFIG['use_exif_thumbnail_for_speed'] = false; // If true, and EXIF thumbnail is available, and is larger or equal to output image dimensions, use EXIF thumbnail rather than actual source image for generating thumbnail. Benefit is only speed, avoiding resizing large image.
00156 
00157 // if true, and source image is smaller than 'w' & 'h' parameters or $PHPTHUMB_CONFIG['output_maxheight'] / $PHPTHUMB_CONFIG['output_maxwidth']
00158 // will be enlarged to that size. If false then small images will not be enlarged beyond their original dimensions
00159 $PHPTHUMB_CONFIG['output_allow_enlarging'] = (isset($_REQUEST['aoe']) ? (bool) $_REQUEST['aoe'] : false);

00169 // If false, any parameters set here cannot be overridden in the URL

00180 
00182 // function for generating hashed calls to phpThumb if 'high_security_enabled'
00183 // echo '<img src="'.phpThumbURL('src=pic.jpg&w=50').'">';
00184 
00185 function phpThumbURL($ParameterString) {
00186  global $PHPTHUMB_CONFIG;
00187  return 'phpThumb.php?'.$ParameterString.'&hash='.md5($ParameterString.$PHPTHUMB_CONFIG['high_security_password']);
00188 }
